title: Setting y to zero
text: To find the x-intercept of a function, we start by setting the y value to 0, so we get the equation $$\frac{1}{2} |x+4|-3=0$$.

title: Isolating the absoluate value
text: Then, we should isolate the part with absolute value. We get the equation $$\frac{1}{2} |x+4|=3$$. Multiply 2 to both sides, we get $$|x+4|=6$$.

title: Solving equation with absoluate values
text: We can break an equation with absolute values down into two equations that we can solve independently. We notice that the absolute value will be equal to 6 if the quantity inside the absolute value is 6 or -6. Therefore, the two equations we get are $$x+4=6$$ and $$x+4=-6$$.

title: Solving the first equation
text: Solve the equation $$x+4=6$$. What is x?

title: Solving the second equation
text: Solve the equation $$x+4=-6$$. What is x?
